ygData.subject: Re: Skill Changes
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Hey, don t get me wrong, I like to see my character advance as much as the next guy!  But I don t think that it is too much to ask that 8-10 hours of
ygData.messageBody:
> From: Doug Sorensen <belgarth_of_surefall@...>
>
> I like to see my character advance, to wait 8 to 10
> hours for a level is definately a bit much. Especially
> since I can then only gain 26 hit points and 5 of each
> skill.

Hey, don't get me wrong, I like to see my character advance as much as the
next guy! But I don't think that it is too much to ask that 8-10 hours of
playtime is too much... That means that to max out (at 50) would take
400-500 hours... that is a LOT of playing time, and that (to me anyway) is a
GOOD thing, not a bad thing! It means that I can either do it FAST (12hrs a
day x 40 days) or slow (4hrs a day x 120 days)... Do you want the game over
in a month or a year, it is up to you after all... As to your HP's, well,
there are other classes and characters that get more...

> There are some people that do nothing other than play
> Everquest, not surprising they are level 50. After I
> would reach level 50 I would try another class.

I feel the same way! Although now that I have gone over level 20, I am
looking at starting another one in addition to my cleric, that I will play
'part time' (perhaps 25% of my playing time) until I get up to Level 50, or
get bored, whichever comes first.

But I am not a power leveler myself, in fact, most people in my 'circle of
friends' that I have played with over the past couple of months are about
3-8 levels above me!

> I think the game should have been designed with a
> higher cap, say 100 and spread the skill points over
> that range.

This would only make you 'Feel Better' or worse, depending on you... If you
want to feel better about it, figure it at 250 levels... and picture in your
mind that each bubble is one level... In any case, it is just a numbers
game...

> Imagine people that can't play 20 hours a week, say 5
> hours a week due to work, school and family
> constraints. then you have to go 2 weeks at your same
> level.

Yes, and they can still enjoy the game just as much if they are not stuck
into the 'Level up' attitude... Again, those that are into 'Leveling up'
will do so... they will power level themselves, play 10-15 hours a day,
etc... That is not me though... or I wouldn't still be Level 22 after
playing for over 18 days (game clock days - actually over 430 hours total
time)... Do the math and you will see that I average about 1 level every 19
hours... hehe... not that great really, but I have lots of fun! I have seen
MANY others who get to level 20 in HALF that time (or less).

> Part of it goes along with not enjoying my ranger
> anymore. I am level 26, near broke and half my armor
> is banded because Rubicite is the next level since we
> can't wear any normal plate. I will probably start a
> cleric and see how it goes.
>
> Belgarth

Welcome to the club! I am level 22 now, have over 100plat in bank, but at
level 24 I will need to spend around 70plat for my spells... I have banded
armor (I made myself - smithing) and still need to waste a bunch of money on
my smithing too! My character CAN wear plate, but it is soooo heavy and
expensive I don't bother...

All in all, my cleric does all right most of the time... I usually only get
killed 1-2 times per level... hehe...

Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server
Proud member of Platinum Sphere Guild - www.platinumsphere.com
